page.title: 13THE LETTUCE FARM
page.content: Mr Lamb owns Linstock Nurseries,a large market garden in this small village a few miles outside Carlisle. He told us about the nurseries.The main crop is lettuce which he grows all the year round,but of course in the winter inside the huge heated greenhouses.He plants them in rotation,in batches of about 6000 at a tme, so that there are always some ready for cropping. He sells them on his family's stall in Carlisle's large covered market and has to get up very early each morning to take them in. He also grows peppers,celery,potatoes and tomatoes,but this is really a lettuce farm.Mr Lamb said that because the weather had been so poor this spring and summer and the automatic heaters had been on for much longer than usual the lettuces cost more.
